title: Textile, 2010-19-1, ca. 1755
provenance: Five lengths of green silk damask purchased by the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation in July 1954 from S.W. Wolsey, London for £55 (see object file). Accession numbers were: 54-964-1/5. July 1988: Colonial Williamsburg Foundation deaccessioned four lengths and sent them to auction. After July 1988: Purchased by Harry Hinson on July 5, 1988 at Christie's South Kensington. Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum, April 2010: Gift of Harry Hinson.
description: Green damask with a pattern of flowers and foliage in a vase framed by a running floral vine.
